Welcome to Divination General! Come here for readings and a discussion of theory/practice.

Every method is welcome: Tarot, Runes, Cartomancy, Scrying, Pendulum, Cleromancy, I-Ching, Oracles, Tasseomancy, Necromancy, etc.

>If you're NEW, please READ the STICKY:
http://pastebin.com/2Wp1Q074

>Recommended /div/ links and books:
https://pastebin.com/sAkg9cMz

>MEGA with Divination Books:
https://mega.nz/folder/Jp8gQD7Q#om_2lEm1GL0qPIpSrQgrvA

>Guides made by some of our readers:
•Rustig on how to start with tarot:
http://i.imgur.com/2rodLWB.png

•Thoth's tarot and rune guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ciFuMOVDIkA18d9Rw-Zkklgigx-Y4XzJkGVeMTYWcic/edit?pref=2&pli=1

•Hijinks' revised divination guide:
https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

>high priestess rx, 4oC rx, 9oP rx

Doesn't look good anon. First off we got 2 - 4 - 9 but all reversed. This indicates conflict, instability, disappointment

The cups to pentacles, emotions revolving around something material.

Clarifying we have 6 to queen. This is about receptivity of communication. Cups to cups, the communication is about emotions, the response to communication is emotional.

You should withdraw and reflect inwards. Consider what is right for you. There may be gossip, talking behind others back and secrets.

The four of cups highlights the need to withdraw for introspection. Don't force yourself to put your self out there in this situation. Don't force yourself to continue with it.

The nine of pentacles says you are over invested, and need to reevaluate your sense of self worth in this situation. Tying back to the previous two indicating withdrawal and reflection. This also ties into the overall theme of a break down in communication.

Six of cups and queen of cups as clarifying. This shows that you are ready to give and recieve without expection in your communication. Remember though this is clarification of the first three. The disappointment predict in them will result from this.

So, no.

You image shows a heart rising above a wasteland. I would suggest you do the same.

The devil is not as scary as it sounds but it does come with warnings. Two big things that stand out here are sexuality and temptation. Addiction can be a big thing with the devil as well, it can be easy to over indulge during a hardship like this. To focus on the sexuality and temptation, balance is key here as indicated by the strength. Moving on can be a big part of healing from this, this does involve sex and flings frequently. The temptation to form a new emotional relationship too quickly is something you need to remain strong and balanced in. As does sexuality, sleeping with others is a common way to move on, this is fine as long as you don't over do it.

The key of strength is balance and inner discipline. With the devil next to it I would keep balance in mind with those aspects I just discussed.

The page of swords and knight of cups reversed is clarifying. The page, a young woman, is youthful feminine or yin energy. The King, a mature man, is mature masculine or yang energy. These don't have to specifically be about people of that specific gender.

The page is also inexperienced. Passion an enthusiasm is a big part of the page of swords. Considering that it is clarifying and the primary reading revolves around balance so much I would suggest being mindful of balance here. It would be easy to become passionate and too emotionally attached quickly, avoid that. You will be exploring self-expression, and new ideas, new experiences as you move on from this.

cont

I am getting tired so my reading will be slower

Two of Cups is the flow of the energy of the cups between two. Usually two people. This can be a partnership in general not just love. The two of Wands has to do with planning ahead, progress, decision, discovery. Together this could indicate working together on planning or a plan. It can also be more abstract, the energies of your cups or emotions working together with you passions.

The nine of cups is a wish come true, contentment, satisfaction. Specifically with emotions. Emotional fulfillment and gratification. It can be a sign to splurge on pleasures but it doesn't fit this reading and it isn't something I recommend in general. This will be good but if you sit still too long this gratification and comfort will only last for so long so you need to keep moving forward, but enjoy it.

The clarification: the sun and 5oS both rx
The sun rx is about your inner child, but can also indicate over optimism. The 5oS can indicate the desire for something to be over. The fact that you are asking this question hints at a desire for excessive optimism to be put to an end.

On the other side though the sun can indicate a struggle with negativity, which the four of pentacles also indicates, a mindset of scarcity. The 5oS also indicates and desire for this to come to an end.

The moon is your inner most desires and fears in this. It indicates illusions, anxieties, and fears

You would seem to fear listening to you intuition. You have a mind set of scarcity, trying to hang onto what you have. The 2 of cups is about the cooperation between your inner child, the one dreaming and your current desires. You need to engage more in planning going into the details to control the outcome without any reliance of things working out without doing so. Be cautious of your inner child driving you towards wish fulfillment instead of well planned out goals.

>7 of swords
The meaning is dependent on what position the card is and in what tarot spread/layout its being used...

You can't say "oh muh 7 of swords vibe" then concoct a reading that adds a little of those qualities and the qualities of those other cards in the spread until you've compiled a groovy sounding sentence highlighting a taste of the qualities of each card present..
Pure artistic license..

There is no "universal" word-salad about 7 of swords that can be tacked onto any tarot spread/layout reading that contains it...
7 of swords by itself used as a significator yields a different meaning to what that card means if it is in the 1st position of a four tarot spread/layout, and is uniquely different again to if it is in the 4th position of a four tarot spread/layout...

So for example with a four tarot spread, the 7 of Swords has a unique meaning in each of those four card positions. Anyone peddling a one size fits all vibe regardless of location and spread... is peddling pure artistic license.

Mars is a highly valuable strategic location.
If you're traveling from the inner solar system to the outer solar system or beyond, and vice versa, Mars is the gateway. A space truck-stop, if you will.
Enough gravity to be useful, but not so much it's too expensive to launch from.
In other words, if your enemy is in the inner solar system, and you want to cut off their access to the rest of it, you'd hit Mars, or the other way around, if you were trying to hold this solar system from an outside force, and were getting pushed back and trapped in the inner solar system, you'd hit Mars.
Earth isn't a blasted wasteland, so I'm assuming it was the latter, and it was successful.

it took a lot of time reading, and lurking to find something that worked for me because my minds wanders a lot but this is what i do:

>get very tired, i usually lift and stay up with no electronics for a while, wash my face that kind of stuff
>find a subliminal audio, these help me because theyre relaxing and keep me focused at the task at hand, ive tried music or just binaural beats but they dont work for me
>just listen to the audio with your eyes closed until you feel a floating sensation or like a wave is passing over your brain or body, keep your mind blank
>once in that floaty feeling imagine a bubble, say to yourself as the bubble grows larger i become more relaxed, then grow the bubble in your imagination until it fully encompasses you, then grow it exponentially until you cannot see it, this is just self hypnosis
>then just imagine your scene, play it over and over adding more and more detail until you fall asleep, make sure to imagine it from YOUR perspective
>then when you wake up forget about what you manifested, dont focus on it

this is just what works for me, i would recommend trying many different methods and taking bits and pieces to make your own method that works the best for you. it takes a lot of trial and error, fuck it took me a year to get to where i manifested something as significant as $1000. but the key is to keep working at it, i lost faith and gave up multiple times calling myself a schizo retard, but now i have $1000 fuckin dollars which i didnt have before. stick to it and youll make it, believe.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Fuckin' posted in the old thread so I'll post it here:

Spaced repetition works for me. I'll work on a script (What does my life look like in ABC amount of time when I have XYZ. What do I feel? What do I think? What do I do? How does that feel? Who am I with? Where am I? etc) & a couple of affirmations in the PRESENT tense as though I already have it & work out the details over a few days. After I feel satisfied with the scrip & affirmations I'll begin to repeat & reaffirm my desire by reading & writing the script & affirmations over & over again FEELING the FEELING of the wish fulfilled & living FROM the end. I'll also record them in my own voice & play them on repeat. Usually I'll also make songs in Garage Band by taking an ambient track & just copy + pasting the voice recordings several times overlayed on the music. I'll listen the songs throughout the day when doing passive activities that make me want to zone out like when I get ready in the morning, when I make food, when I work out & when I drive, etc. You get the idea. I also normally meditate daily & once I have memorized the script & affirmations along with their flow, cadence & FEELING I will visualize them in my daily morning meditation & just really vividly get into them. Usually 2 or 3 weeks go by & then it will have become an imprinted memory meaning that I can recall the image & feeling at any given moment throughout the day, doesn't matter what I'm doing or in the middle of. This is when I know that I am on the right track & that it is working. After a month goes by I simply re-read & re-write & visualize in a meditation session once every other day then I drop it. I come back to it every once in a while to make sure I am in still on the level of awareness & the desire matches my beliefs.

(1 of 2)

>>33664297
Your confusion comes from not really understanding what astrology actually is.

Astrology is an interpretive science where you must link causation to correlation. You have to, judging by the placements for the event under consideration, isolate the particular matters you are concerned about from both the chart and the real life situation, and then apprehend the particular manifestation of that matter in this instance and identify the features unique to it. You must both draw a commonality between this instance and other instances of the exact same placement, as well as rationally distinguish this kind of situation from other placements concerning the same sort of matter.

In the distant past long before astrology was "settled", the planets presumably had no names, or at the very least not descriptive ones that denoted any symbolism to use. They looked up at the cosmos and charted what they saw without any inkling of what it meant. At some point, some people noticed that certain things happened when certain cosmological objects were in particular spots in space. They investigated the link between human psychology and cosmological placements and eventually were able to associate aspects of human behavior with influences astrological bodies were apparently exerting.

They deduced that the body known as Mercury seemed to be affecting the particular ways people rationally think and communicate; and looking at the zodiac signs, the influence seemed to come out most emblematically in Gemini, who are known for thinking and speaking miles ahead of everyone else, and who seem to find their life's fulfillment in these activities.

The system established early on that every astrological body around Earth must have an influence upon the beings upon it. That only leaves the question of what each one does, ascertained through intense study: not of your textbooks, but of your case studies: astrology as a science is exegesis; it's not an "art" where meaning's created.

Mars in Capricorn is an exaltation, which is an enhancement of the power of the planet in that sign. Mars represents willpower, and Capricorn takes that and bridles it; it's thought that natives can accomplish anything they set their mind to, for this lends an indomitable will that refuses to die.

Venus in domicile Libra perhaps creates a self-indulgent character, one that is concerned with personal pleasure first and will also manipulate others to serve one's personal happiness.

Mercury in Scorpio might indicate a vindictive mode of thought, a plotting one, driven by obsessions---but obsessions aren't really a bad thing.

If you've never once obsessed over anything intellectual or complex and came out of it with a very advanced and above average understanding of it relative to other people, then you will probably continue to live your life with wasted potential. From my point of view, the Mars and Mercury are probably your most desirable placements; the rest are average or even perhaps detrimental.

>>33665072
Exaltation is a discovered placement that has the effect of taking the planet's energies and getting rid of most if not all of the bad parts and only keeping the good.

Imagine you have a lion as a guard animal. The domicile is the lion's master and it mostly obeys its will but ocassionally gets out of control and bites what it isn't supposed to.
Detriment, it doesn't obey at all, it does little to nothing for it, neither good or bad.
Fall, it's mostly hostile and attacks the native more than it obeys.
Exaltation is like having a leash, a whip, catnip, the whole nine yards for keeping it under control and getting it to do precisely whatever you command it to. It's not its master per se but because it isn't its "baby" the native doesn't treat it with kiddy gloves when it gets out of line; the planet is its samurai, sworn to serve the exalted in utter obeisance.

Exaltation is getting all of the benefit of a planet's energy/influence but without the danger of being overtaken by it. A domicile gets the full expression of the energy, and that necessarily includes the unsavory parts.

>>33665450
Yes, that is correct.

The Ego is of course what we would traditionally call someone's personality. It is the foundation of who that person is and how they consciously behave for the very most part. This is why in laymen's understanding everything beyond the sun sign is secondary or irrelevant, because the Sun as Ego constitutes much of what we can know about ourselves and others without much observation and analysis.

The Superego in a Freudian model is concerned with regulating and directing behavior, arbitrating between what one wishes to do and what one ought to do. The Ascendant lends a sense of ought to one's personality and will be the voice in your head throughout your life telling you what to do.

The Ascendant has been called the persona, the image we project to the world especially to strangers, the mask and pretense that obscures the ego from initial view, but that's not wholly accurate. In unfamiliar territory, the ascendant steps in to regulate how we proceed---it leads the way and guides the rest of the self behind it. But its role doesn't stop there. The ascendant, again, charts the course for your approach to life, your inward feeling of lifepath.

Midheaven I haven't quite figured out yet. Nor IC for that matter. But as of right now, given the common assumption that it has to do with career and thus self-assertion upon and self-insertion within society, I think MC might be associated with ambition and work.

If the ascendant is the ideation of a "calling", then the midheaven perhaps might be the physicality of that calling: again, the "work" you'll end up wanting to do.

>>33668030
These two perspectives aren't mutually exclusive.

Master--Servant, Actor/Agent--Environment

This is the first time I've ever heard your metaphor/analogy. It requires Tarot-like thinking where you assign archetypes to everything. If the Sun is a king, then what is *Jupiter* supposed to be? It's fraught with such unsolved mystery.

My conception of the relationship makes the planet an Equip Spell card and each zodiac sign is a Monster card of its own unique type. You have the planets as the Monster cards and the signs as Field Spell cards.

My intention was to show how each sign is its own person who wields the planets like weapons. Think of Soul Calibur, how each weapon is as unique as each character, and how some skill with one weapon may translate into a certain amount of skill with another and badness with yet another. The difference is that nobody presumably would ever be stronger using someone else's weapon than they would be with their own, which they mastered.

On the contrary, here I am saying that domicile is the placement where you are naturally gifted at an untrained level: thus there is an inherent lack of discipline at play and bad habits will reveal themselves. The exaltation is a placement where the planet is wielded by someone who has been trained and ordained to wield it most *effectively*, which specifically means not using it any old which way that it might lend itself to: the notion that just because something can do a thing doesn't mean it should do a thing.

See this example: Mars is full well capable of the nuclear option, so to speak, and Aries will find itself inclined to hit the button regularly. But Capricorn understands you ought not use nukes willy nilly and have to use them strategically, if at all. It has been disciplined in the art of Mars such that it can utilize the tools in its box for maximun effectiveness in its mission, and let alone the tools also in there that aren't optimal.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

>>33648519
It's kinda strange to explain it.
Most people nowadays live in their thinking minds, they don't live in the here and now and they only live through a lens of thinking which dictates their being, they usually think about the past and the future more than the here and now.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

Meditate on what's in front of you at any given time, "meditation" is not an act but more like a mode of being in which you accept and receive anything which is in front of you at that momment.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I'm late to the party but here's what you do. Sit crossed legged or in a chair with your back straight. Put your attention gently on the breath. Don't intensely force your attention to stay on it. Eventually you will notice your mind is wandering. Take a brief moment to acknowledge this and return your attention to the breath. If it helps, you can mentally says "in" and "out" as you breathe in and out, or "beginning" and "end" to mark the beginning and end of each in and out breath.

This is the starting technique in >>33643926 which I also highly recommend reading.

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

That day, a 4chan user submitted a thread to /pol/ saying they heard “something about an alien being posted before the site went down.
Meanwhile, a Pastebin page was created with relevant links and information about the alien photograph post. Also on February 22nd, various 4chan posts were created claiming that the image was being covered up by the government.

posts.sub: Mysterious disappearances in a small town
posts.com:
I have a story to share during my stay in a small town. I can't really share the location because of privacy reasons, I hope you all understand. Here we go.

>After I finished my Master's, I secured a job with a big questionable company which has offices even in remote locations
>Now, the company policy dictates that newbies should work in remote locations for 2 years, and depending on the performance, they can come work at the headquarters in the city
>Since I was a newbie, they threw me in a small town in the middle of bumfuck nowhere
>The nearest town was 2 hours away so it really really sucked
>The first 3 months in the office was alright
>It was me and 4 other dumbfuck employees
>All of us were newbies
>One fine day, we had a local guy come into the office
>I was chatting up with him, and suddenly we heard an inhuman loud shriek coming from the mountains located at the back of the town
>I freaked the fuck out because wtf
>The guy started to mumble saying "Oh no, oh shit, it has begun" and just ran away midway
>It freaked me out even more at that point
>Next day, I ran into him at the local supermarket and I asked him wtf happened to him the day before
>He kind of tried to avoid me by giving vague answers, but since I was the new guy in the town, he caved in and told me that there is something out there which is responsible for disappearances in the town
>Whenever that thing shrieks (happens once every 3 months), somebody in the town disappears (4 people/yr)
>At first, I thought it was a load of bullshit, but the look on his face said otherwise
>But still I asked him to prove the disappearance
>He said that it won't come in the news or newspapers because people in the town were ordered to be keep their mouths shut by the town police chief
>Again, I thought what a bunch of baloney
>Next day, the chief comes into my office and makes us all sit down for a talk
>He then asks us if we heard the shriek yesterday
>We all nodded our heads saying yes

Cont...

I'm actually very interested in this OP, and have some related awareness and experience of the same, though mine starts almost 30 years ago and leads up to what you describe.

I have some theories on what it is.

I'll try to keep it brief, I can add more if needed.
The first time I noticed it was around the time I was 19. It was not as severe, and it lasted briefly. Then it appeared a few years later during college.
It happened a few times over the years, once in my early 30s, once in my late 30s.
Each time though, it seems to get more severe and last longer.
This last round was the worst/strongest yet, and occurred as you say, after that time period.
I seem to have noticed it affecting others also, though only in a specific instance or so.

I have some theories on what is happening.
I think it has to do with the nervous system's response to trauma, survival mechanisms, and differences between the "left and right" brain.

Basically, when enough trauma is received/perceived the brain in attempt to help the organism, realizes that old methods aren't working, and that it needs something drastically new. It then "flushes" the pathways to both make room for new neural pathways, and at the same time overwrite some of the old ones.
The brain reboots. In the process it loses some details around the edges.

Cont.

The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

> I feel even worse and have more suffering in my daily life when I don't have companionship like a pet, or when I don't get to eat pizza
Hat is precisely the point Buddha was making: when you attach yourself to material things you only set yourself up for greater suffering once these things get taken away from you, which they always are because all material things are fleeting. Buddhism posits that to truly overcome suffering, you must detach yourself from worldly desires and focus on spiritual growth, which unlike said desires can never be taken from you. I'm not a Buddhist, but I do believe that applying this mentality the right way can improve your ability to handle adversity.

posts.sub: Color is not in your mind
posts.com:
I know many of you know this already, but I think it's an idea that will help those who don't.

When talking about meditation, and going beyond the mind it may sound all "mystical" to some people, because we're trained to think _everything_ is mental.
But really the idea is so simple, there are things literally right in front of your face that are beyond your mind. You only need to have a realization of such.

Take "color" for example. If color lived in your mind, then you could explain exactly what the color "red" was like to someone who's never seen it before.
But no matter how hard you try to explain it, that person will still weep the 1st time they actually see red, because nothing can prepare them for it. Nothing is red except red itself.

This is why "watching" conscious experiences can take your awareness out of your mind. Watching your breath, watching your thoughts, watching bodily sensations (i.e. the feeling of having a hand, a face, a torso), watching sound (not "hearing" but watching the pure sensation of sound itself).
All of those things are beyond your mind. And you KNOW them because you ARE them. Just as you know your mind because you are it, because the mind is just 1 realm of experience, but it's a realm that this reality is trying to lock you up in, so it can have the illusion of controlling you. It wants you to believe all those other things are also in your mind too, but they're not.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33670198
Probably they're just points in a color space with the primary colors as dimensions. So orange is like a vector between red and green.
Red doesn't end or begin at another color any more than "up" ends where "left" begins. They're orthogonal.

What I was suggesting in the OP is that the dimensions of reality are conscious sensations/experiences.
A dimension is just a degree-of-freedom.
There are likely several dimensions of "thought" experiences which is what I was calling the "mental realm".

Same as how color (as we perceive it) is 3 dimensions of red, green, and blue.

posts.com:
Is divination just manifesting, /X/?

Let's use a tarot reading as an example. You're given a reading that informs you about your future in the form of a ritual. You spend your time and energy, both in and out of the reading, thinking about the future that the cards gave you. Isn't that time being spent manifesting a future that was given to you by random chance?

Is divination a scam? You're just removing the agency of your future and putting it into luck.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33667688
No. Divination and manifestation are complete opposites. Divination using tarot is when you shuffle the deck and read the cards you pull without your own will influencing the outcome, it's like you are standing on a hill observing your surroundings. Manifestation is flipping through the decks and picking the cards you want in order to influence a specific outcome, this is like picking a destination on the horizon and travelling towards it. Divination is passive, Manifestation is active. You can combine them easily, such as drawing 3 different spreads and picking the one you prefer, this is like viewing potential timelines, however it's important not to confuse the two acts as if they are one, that will only fuck with whichever outcome you want while likely getting you lost (metaphorically speaking).

posts.com:
A gnome destroyed my life. Ever since my first "gnoming," I've had a strange fondness for the little guy. He always seemed so happy, scampering into frame and playing his little pranks. But eventually, my patience began to wear thin. I would see him in EVERY comment section, always lurking amid walls of text to fool me yet again. After a while, I started to lose sleep. I would go days without eating, for fear that I would see him, staring around the corner while I made a sandwich.I stopped leaving my room. I became a recluse, only leaving my apartment to buy groceries. And then came the day that I saw him. Standing in the aisle at Walmart, examining the candy section. I was stunned. Floored, even. He turned to me, and opened his mouth. I don't remember what exactly happened. All I knew was that I couldn't let him deliver his mocking diatribe.I couldn't let him gnome me. Next thing I remember, I'm standing in the cutlery aisle, soaked in blood. At my feet lies the corpse of the "gnome" - an innocent ten year old boy, clad in green. I've been running for the past ten hours. I stopped at a gas station outside of Lancaster to fuel up, and hit the road again. Once I reach Las Vegas, I'm going to lay low, rack up some savings, and head east. Start a new life somewhere else. Sometimes, when I close my eyes, I can see him. The gnome stares at me from the darkness, daring me to return, to pay for my crimes. A single tear runs down my cheek, and I realize the truth.

I was being gnomed from the start.

Thread 404'd, didn't realize there was a general on, so, re-posting:

Gentlemen, I now officially believe in gnomes.
Ever since I've started reading about them, my gnomish encounters have skyrocketed.

Just today, I keep my toothpaste in the bathroom, right?
Of course, it'd be the most obvious that it'd be on the counter - where I leave it every single day.

Well, today, it wasn't there.
Now, you might say, "well, someone might have moved it" - very true; however, I was in the bathroom, locked, by myself, when I took my morning shower, so nobody could have come in or out.

My toothpaste was still missing, and I'd been looking for it the entire time I was there - after giving up, as I mentioned, I went to take my shower.
When I came out, it's right there, in the middle of the fucking counter.

Now, I actually like gnomes, but this is an unprecedented degree of mischief that I'd just not seen before.
This is the least mystical of my recent experiences, but consider me officially gnomepilled.
I bet there's one in my fucking computer right now, and in the walls.
Thankfully, as a Slav, we consider house spirits to be friendly, and take care not to upset them, so I hope my standing with the gnomes is good.

posts.com: I've actually had quite a few experiences with gnomes, like 5 different instances. Will take a couple of posts to share them all. I'll go in chronological order. So, the gnomery started a few years ago when my friends and I were all NEETS during the covid. We went to a huge mountainous arboretum on the outskirts of my town in the Pacific Northwest. We explored away from the trails and found an abandoned quarry. No idea what they mined, but they blew up the entrance and now it's covered in a rockslide. Above the rockslide was a waterfall, and below it was an abandoned dynamite delivery truck from the 1920's. It had shipping container doors. It had sunken into the soil up to the wheels and was covered in a thick layer of moss and ferns. We opened the rusty shipping container doors and it was perfectly preserved inside. So we made it our fort/clubhouse and would go there to hang out at least a few days out of the week...

Gnosticism in fact has the same heavily dualistic, good-vs.-evil cosmic theogony implicitly or explicitly, frequently found in the official beliefs and literature of the Abrahamic faiths, throughout the Old and New Testaments and the Quran (Yahweh vs. Satan, God vs. Lucifer, Allah vs. Iblis), with the complicated addition that the “Demiurge” or “Yaldabaoth” of the Gnostics is here Satan, and is held to have a unique influence and reign over the Earth and humanity and also played a role in their creation.

Several times in the Book of John, Christ refers to Satan as the “prince of this world,” just as the Demiurge is held to be the ruler of material reality keeping the sparks of our higher souls trapped in a fleshy, material prison. See John 12:31

>Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

In Gnosticism, the archons (lit. “rulers” or “ruling gods” in Greek) carry out the same function as the demonic spirits or fallen angels in Abrahamic theology regarded as subordinate to and carrying out the will of their master and ruler, Satan, Lucifer, or
Iblis. These demonic, archontic, or, in the Sanskrit terminology of Hindu mythology, asuric (from asura, demons in Hindu and Buddhist theology) forces are held to subtly possess, control, influence, monitor, oversee and prod humanity in the directions they want humanity to go, in their insane demented rebellion against God.

The archons in fact, in Gnosticism, carry out the same role as the malevolent, nonhuman, spiritual entities said by St. Paul to be ruling the world in Ephesians — with the original Greek word for “rulers” Paul used, actually being the same word “archon” as the Gnostics used to refer to these demons subordinate to the Demiurge!

>For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers [archontes] of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.
Ephesians 6:12

>>33667187
In Gnosticism, somewhat similarly as in Christianity, Christ is revered and accepted as a messenger of God, even if some mind-boggling way Himself equivalent to God, and metaphorically “God’s Son”. As in Christianity, God takes this sacrifice of His own physical incantation on the Earth upon Himself out of love, pity, sorrow and mercy over humanity’s plight, the plight of His children. Hence, He comes in a mission similar to both Christianity and Gnosticism of “redeeming us from mortality, corruption, sin, decay, death and harsh punishment merited to us,” with the distinction that Gnosticism does not have the same agreement on atonement theology as mainstream Christianity does (holding Christ’s crucifixion as a “propitiatory sacrifice which took all the sins of the world upon Himself and thereby redeemed us of our sins”).

Rather, Gnosticism paints the incarnation fo Christ, analogously, as more like an incredibly kind, loving, compassionate, knowledgeable, wise and advanced doctor from a more developed civilizational position going to a third-world nation to administer to and help cure the patients there after some cosmic/planetary disaster which made the suffering inhabitants require help from outside themselves.

In Gnosticism, it is not JUST that we are morally corrupt, decaying, and hence “damned” in that sense, but also (if not even more significantly) that we are spiritually “sick,” “occluded”, or “blinded.” Our problem is lack of Knowledge or Gnosis (Greek for “knowledge”) at least as much as it is the heavily morally laden notion of sin.

You can change the past, though. Here is how you do it:

>Examine the past as you believe it to be.
>Understand that this is merely a belief, and nothing more, and it can be changed.
>Then imagine a new way to see that same past with a new perspective that better serves you.

That's the magic spell for changing the past. Be careful with it, because it is very powerful. One wrong word here and you will change the entire world in ways you may not have intended. Ask yourself lots of questions about what you desire and whether or not your new perspective is the right one for you and your destiny.
